pullRequest.title: Inlining test-pom into test and removing test-jdk8
pullRequest.bodyText:
See #3838 (review) for background. It has been close to a year and no JDK-8-specific tests have materialized. These would not be tests which only run on JDK 8, which you can easily control via Assume, but tests which only compile via JDK 8. The only reason to do that which we have encountered is to compile against Oracle JDK-internal classes, which in turn we only needed to do in order to keep our own local copy of ysoserial, which includes various widgets based on non-API classes, but JEP-200 and the removal of Remoting-based CLI removed the need to ever do this again. Of course if things change, we could just revert this patch if that seems like the easiest thing.
The diff as displayed by GitHub is unfortunately quite long. As explained here, if you pass -B to a local git diff (or git show -p), you get a reviewable diff:
diff --git pom.xml pom.xml
index a3d14f58a9..5ef3caf421 100755
--- pom.xml
+++ pom.xml
@@ -52,7 +52,6 @@ THE SOFTWARE.
     <module>bom</module>
     <module>core</module>
     <module>war</module>
-    <module>test-pom</module>
     <module>test</module>
     <module>cli</module>
   </modules>
@@ -657,14 +656,5 @@ THE SOFTWARE.
         <jdk>11</jdk>
       </activation>
     </profile>
-    <profile>
-      <id>jdk8</id>
-      <modules>
-        <module>test-jdk8</module>
-      </modules>
-      <activation>
-        <jdk>1.8</jdk>
-      </activation>
-    </profile>
   </profiles>
 </project>
diff --git test-jdk8/pom.xml test-jdk8/pom.xml
deleted file mode 100644
index 70c4870837..0000000000
diff --git test-pom/pom.xml test/pom.xml
similarity index 98%
rename from test-pom/pom.xml
rename to test/pom.xml
index a7ff21aa8c..a6a2781792 100644
--- test-pom/pom.xml
+++ test/pom.xml
@@ -31,11 +31,10 @@ THE SOFTWARE.
     <version>${revision}${changelist}</version>
   </parent>
 
-  <artifactId>jenkins-test-parent</artifactId>
+  <artifactId>jenkins-test</artifactId>
 
-  <name>Jenkins core tests POM</name>
-  <description>Parent POM for Functional tests for Jenkins core</description>
-  <packaging>pom</packaging>
+  <name>Tests for Jenkins core</name>
+  <description>Functional tests for Jenkins core</description>
 
   <properties>
     <concurrency>2</concurrency> <!-- may use e.g. 2C for 2 × (number of cores) -->

commit.message: Inlining test-pom into test and removing test-jdk8

nodes.bodyText:
Wouldn't it be better to use the spotbugs annotations rather than findbugs?
<!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.github.spotbugs/spotbugs-annotations -->
<dependency>
    <groupId>com.github.spotbugs</groupId>
    <artifactId>spotbugs-annotations</artifactId>
    <version>3.1.12</version>
    <scope>provided</scope>
</dependency>
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -27,14 +27,375 @@ THE SOFTWARE.
 
   <parent>
     <groupId>org.jenkins-ci.main</groupId>
-    <artifactId>jenkins-test-parent</artifactId>
+    <artifactId>jenkins-parent</artifactId>
     <version>${revision}${changelist}</version>
-    <relativePath>../test-pom</relativePath>
   </parent>
 
   <artifactId>jenkins-test</artifactId>
 
   <name>Tests for Jenkins core</name>
   <description>Functional tests for Jenkins core</description>
 
+  <properties>
+    <concurrency>2</concurrency> <!-- may use e.g. 2C for 2 × (number of cores) -->
+    <mavenDebug>false</mavenDebug>
+    <jacocoSurefireArgs /><!-- empty by default -->
+  </properties>
+
+  <dependencyManagement>
+    <dependencies>
+      <dependency>
+        <groupId>org.jenkins-ci.main</groupId>
+        <artifactId>jenkins-bom</artifactId>
+        <version>${project.version}</version>
+        <type>pom</type>
+        <scope>import</scope>
+      </dependency>
+      <dependency>
+        <groupId>com.google.code.findbugs</groupId>
+        <artifactId>annotations</artifactId>
+        <version>3.0.1</version>
+        <scope>provided</scope>
+      </dependency>
